abstract: World Health Organization reports nearly fourfold increase of new Ebola cases in Guinea and Sierra Leone in latest week of reporting, to about 35; say some risky practices like unsafe burials of Ebola victims contributes to rise.
lead_paragraph: Officials at the World Health Organization said that there had been a nearly fourfold increase during the most recent week of reporting, to about 35 new cases.

headline.main: Doctors Link Risky Burials to Ebola Rise in West Africa
headline.print_headline: Doctors Link Risky Burials to Ebola Rise in West Africa

snippet: Officials at the World Health Organization said that there had been a nearly fourfold increase during the most recent week of reporting, to about 35 new cases.
